review.body: Phenomenal!!!! You are The woman with the insane pen game!!!.....K.Redman

Interesting tale of a woman's life with historical context

I really enjoyed this story of a woman and her journey through childhood poverty and family struggle, her friendships, romantic relationships, and education and careers. All set in context of WW1 and 2, women's suffrage movement, and Jewis...
Gripping and suspenseful. Is it too late for me to get my review on the cover? It is? Oh well.

A nice, fast read with a steady plot.

Josh and Carissa had met some time ago before he was deployed. When he returns, she’s now been with his friend. They all have a code, No One goes with a friend’s ex. So ensues the drama.

I like second chance romance, but I’m not sure I see why they felt they h...

review.body: Just a few chapters in and I am already pulled in by the excellent storytelling...
Great teen voice; fast read.

Okay, so I was lured by the delicious-looking blueberries on the cover. This was light and sweet, and, yes, a bit unrealistic but I did enjoy the story of a successful NYC attorney who visits her grandmother's hometown in Maine only to (literally) fall for the local guy. What is she doing? She ha...

As Pride & Prejudice is one of my favorite books, I love anything to do with that story and have read many not as enjoyable "continuing" stories of the Bennett sisters. This one however was very enjoyable and tells the story of the "downstairs" help that keep the Bennett manor running smoothl...

Seventeen-year-old Cadence is visiting her family's private island where her accident happened two summers ago. She suffers from debilitating migraines as she tries to remember the events before she woke up on that beach half-naked. What she does remember is her close friendship with her cousins...

book.title: The Boys in the Boat: Nine Americans and Their Epic Quest for Gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics

review.body: Highly compelling narrative nonfiction. The author weaves a beautiful tapestry with the compelling stories of unique individuals coming together physically and emotionally as a team that, despite overwhelming odds, beat the German home team in eight-man crew at the Nazi Olympics in 1936. The best...

book.title: The Nazis Next Door: How America Became a Safe Haven for Hitler's Men

review.body: Interesting information. I knew that many Nazi's had come to America after World War II, however I thought it was only those who had been minor officials or desk workers, cogs, not high level slaughteres. I'm glad I know the truth.
Loved this blend of fantasy and folklore.
